text.0: immortal jātavedas thou manyhued fulgent gift of dawn.
text.1: agni this day to him who pays oblations bring the gods who waken with the morn.
text.2: for thou art offeringbearer and loved messenger the charioteer of sacrifice.
text.3: accordant with the aśvins and with dawn grant us heroic strength and lofty fame.
text.4: as messenger we choose today agni the good whom many love.
text.5: smokebannered spreader of the light at break of day glory of sacrificial rites.
text.6: him noblest and most youthful richly worshipped guest dear to the men who offer gifts.
text.7: him agni jātavedas i beseech at dawn that he may bring the gods to us.
text.8: thee agni will i glorify deathless nourisher of the world.
text.9: immortal offeringbearer meet for sacred food preserver best at sacrifice.
text.10: tell good things to thy praiser o most youthful god as richly worshipped honeytongued.
text.11: and granting to praskaṇva lengthened days of life show honour to the heavenly host.
text.12: for the men agni kindle thee as all possessor and as priest.
text.13: so agni muchinvoked bring hither with all speed the gods the excellently wise.
text.14: at dawn of day at night uṣas and savitar the aśvins bhaga agnis self.
text.15: skilled in fair rites with soma poured the kaṇvas light thee the oblationwafting god.
text.16: for agni lord of sacrifice and messenger of men art thou.
text.17: bring thou the gods who wake at dawn who see the light this day to drink the soma juice.
text.18: thou shonest forth o agni after former dawns all visible o rich in light.
text.19: thou art our help in battlestrife the friend of man the great high priest in sacrifice.
text.20: like manu we will stablish thee agni performer of the rite.
text.21: invoker ministering priest exceeding wise the swift immortal messenger.
text.22: when as the gods high priest by many loved thou dost their mission as their nearest friend.
text.23: then like the farresounding billows of the flood thy flames o agni roar aloud.
text.24: hear agni who hast ears to hear with all thy train of escort gods.
text.25: let mitra aryaman seeking betimes our rite seat them upon the sacred grass.
text.26: let those who strengthen law who bountifully give the lifetongued maruts hear our praise.
text.27: may lawsupporting varuṇa with the aśvins twain and uṣas drink the soma juice.
